intro: Romulea eximia, commonly known as the golden star lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a white center. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and has a short, stout stem. Romulea eximia is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant and long-lasting blooms.
